p: C. longa had the most effective toxicity in the adulticidal screening experiment on M. domestica, with the LD 50 being 77.01 µg/fly, followed by O. gratissimum (83.11 µg/fly), B. rotunda (103.59 µg/fly), C. hystrix (106.87 µg/fly) and Z. limonella (225.50 µg/fly) ( Table 4). Therefore, the three most effective EOs— C. longa, B. rotunda and O. gratissimum—were selected for adulticidal activity against the three blow fly species, C. megacephala, C. rufifacies and L. cuprina.
